page.title: 19St.Andrew's Church Chadd'wth
page.content: There is a fine Norman Door the porch on the south side. Inside the door is a Norman font with wooden cover. The clock in the tower in memory of Phillip Wroughton who died in 1910. The tower also holds 4 bells. A feature are the two side chapels on the north side with access by wooden steps.The first is in memory of the owners of Woolley Park first the Tippings and then the Wroughtons. The second chapel doubles as vestry and has part of a Royal Coat of Arms from 1772 taken from above the south door where is a copy. In the Nave is the tomb of Will. Saunders Died 4th March 1720 leaving money for 8 poor boys to be educated and Â£5 to the vicar of Chaddleworth for ever!.The brass lectern is a gift from the Dean of Westminster patron of the living.
